list_definition.definition: having a lot of strong wind, heavy rain etc
full of anger or uncontrolled feeling

list_ex_of_english: We have had a quiet debate after a rather stormy start.
We are now moving from the stormy waters of reform into the relative calm of consolidation.
We have the same problem in this country, and the position of the denominational schools has a very long and stormy history.
If you face unknown dangers, stormy turbulent seas which may toss you one way or another—and you are not sure which—you do two things.
The men finally involved in the fighting had been at sea for many weeks in stormy seas living in cramped conditions.
I have attended many meetings of miners at election times which have been much more stormy than this gathering.
Flax canvas is much nicer to handle in wet stormy weather than is cotton, which is horrible, or man-made polyester, which deteriorates in bright sunlight.
The captain came to the conclusion that he had taken a wrong turn and walked into the sea on a particularly stormy night.
